content: by rebecca compton email knit fink@gmail com blog www knit-fink livejournal com materials us h/8 5 00 mm crochet hook worsted weight yarn this bag is made with red heart super saver 100% acrylic 6oz/170g in 0358 lavender 4 safety pins or stitch markers tape measure finished size 16 w x 10 h un-stretched and excluding handles gauge 17 double_crochet / 9 row = 4 inches obtaining exact gauge is not necessary for this project pick a hook size that will give you a firm bag bottom bag bottom chain 18 stitches row 1 double_crochet into 3rd chain from hook double_crochet in each st across chain 2 turn 16 double_crochet row 2-19 double_crochet in 1st st and each st across row chain 2 sts turn next row double_crochet in 1st st and each st across row piece should measure 10 in length see picture a continue row 3 double_crochet into corner of bottom double_crochet evenly across long edge of bottom ~42 double_crochet 3 double_crochet into corner double_crochet across chain sts 3 double_crochet into corer double_crochet evenly across long edge of bottom 3 double_crochet into corner slip st in top of chain 2st you will now be working in the round see picture b for two color bag cut yarn and using a contrasting color work a round of single_crochet into each double_crochet of previous round bags sides slip st through last st worked *chain 5 skip three double_crochet single_crochet for two color bag and single_crochet into next double_crochet st * repeat until you reach the end of the round if you end with 4 double_crochet stitches skip 4 double_crochet sts if you end with 5 double_crochet sts skip four double_crochet on each of last two chain 5 sections slip st into first st of round you will now be working in a spiral see picture c tier 2-15 slip st into ch5 space chain 1 slip st into chain 5 space *chain 5 and slip st into next chain 5 space * repeat to end of round slip st into first st of round picture d and e show the spiral step to the next tier bag edge slip st into chain 5 space chain 2 and double_crochet into chain 5 space three times *double_crochet into next chain 5 space four times * repeat to end of round slip st into top of chain 2 at beg of round see picture f for two color bag cut yarn and switch to contrasting color next round chain 2 and double_crochet into each double_crochet of previous round cut yarn handles lay bag flat top of bag should measure ~16 using tape measure and stitch markers/safety pins mark the center 10 see picture g single_crochet into two stitches right of marker a single_crochet across to one stitch past marker b slip st into next st chain 1 see picture h *turn single_crochet into next five stitches chain 1 * repeat for next 37 row or until handle measures 10 you will now attach
